email.subject: [CFP] IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things (IEEE AIoT 2024) 24–26 July 2024, Melbourne, Australia

conference.name: IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things

call_for_papers.description: IEEE AIoT 2024 aims at bringing together interested parties (universities, research centers, industries and stakeholders) from around the world working in the fields of AI and Internet of Things to exchange opinions, discuss brand-new ideas, developing innovative and emerging solutions, and establishing new collaborations.
topics: Edge AI and Distributed Intelligence
Machine Learning for IoT Applications
Mobile deployment of LLMs
Generative AI and LLMs for IoT applications
AI-empowered Robotics and Sensing for IoT
Smart Cities: AI and IoT Solutions
Security and Privacy in AI-driven IoT Systems
5G and its Impact on AI and IoT
Blockchain Technology for Securing IoT Devices
Human-Machine Interaction in IoT Environments
IoT Sensors and Actuators: Innovations and Advances
AI-driven Data Analytics and Decision-making
Energy-Efficient AI Algorithms for IoT Devices
IoT in Healthcare: Applications and Challenges
Industrial IoT (IIoT) and AI for Manufacturing
Smart Agriculture: AI and IoT in Precision Farming
Ethical Considerations in AI-powered IoT Systems
IoT Standards and Interoperability
Robotic Process Automation (RPA) in IoT
AI-driven Automation in Supply Chain Management
IoT Analytics and Big Data Processing
AI in Edge Devices: Challenges and Solutions
Wireless Sensor Networks in AI and IoT
IoT for Environmental Monitoring and Sustainability
AI and IoT in Transportation and Logistics
Cross-domain Integration of AI and IoT Technologies
Privacy, Security, and Trustworthiness
Standardization and Interoperability
Demonstrations, Proof-of-Concepts, and Deployments

keynote_chair.name: Song Guo
keynote_chair.affiliation: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, China

tutorial_chairs.name: Flora Salim
tutorial_chairs.affiliation: University of New South Wales, Australia

journal_opportunity.description: Three accepted papers will be selected for best paper awards. Selected papers will be recommended to IEEE Internet of Things Journal (IF: 10.238) and Digital Communications and Networks (IF: 7.9) for potential fast-track publications.

submission_details.submission_format: Papers should not have more than six (6) IEEE style pages including results, figures and references. One (1) extra page is allowed with an extra charge of $100.
submission_details.review_process: Papers will be reviewed with the standard reviewing procedure (with at least 3 independent anonymous reviews).
